channel.title: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling
channel.description:
Just bought Skyrim and i like it much!
it does give me give back the feeling of When i was a noob in runescape for a reason.
to bad i killed all blacksmiths and stable guys :S so now have to start over
anyways what do you guys think of skyrim??

item.title: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:6, topic:436045”]Runescape needs to take pointers from Elder Scrolls more like it.[/quote]APPLES AND ORANGES YOU DICK

item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

ytuio9`:

Haha… you wouldn’t have survived 5 minutes in morrowind

I mean i went rambo in whiterun and riverwood and stuff xd

anyways i’m tired of adding Skyrim Quests to my rsps
so now its time for me to actually play skyrim

Skyrim is honestly such a disappointment.[/quote]

i Didn’t know they would be death for the hole game XD
i was in a Rambo mood and killed anything i saw

i thought those guys repspawn after a few hours

item.title: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

Guy’s he’s just saying he has near that same feeling like when you first found RuneScape you were younger and it just seemed, dare me to say it, magical. Something about it was diffrent when I first found it that made me fall in love, that’s what he’s saying. Not (Nor way Skyrim > RuneScape ftw!).

yes!

its the same magical feeling that a whole world is there to be discovered, once i seen all lands of runescape i felt sad that there wasn’t anything to discover anymore

so this kinda gives that feeling

Read full topic
item.source: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling

item.title: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

Probably have around 50 hours worth on skyrim, loved it but now I actually don’t really wanna go play it anymore… Maybe its because iv fucked my character up by doing a stupid side mission where every time i now open a chest, instead of being surprised whats inside, there’s a bunch of diamonds and shit inside which makes me have unlimited cash… >.> not fun.

Read full topic

item.source: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling

item.title: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:14, topic:436045”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=538769.msg3942454#msg3942454 date=1331515891]
Wish skyrim had more difficulty.

What was arena made for?
[/quote]
Umm, you can change the difficulty on skyrim…[/quote]
Beth’s difficulty systems are a bit ridiculous. They aren’t really changing the difficulty, they’re just adding more health. A more complex difficulty system would be great.

The Wanderer:

No what OS haha.

According to the Elder Scrolls Wiki, it was made for MS-Dos.

Read full topic

No what OS haha.

It’s talking about the Arena that was in Oblivion.

Technically oblivion (because I always used fast travel) was so small, yet hard to go to essential places because they were so far away.

Fuck Cyrodiil

item.source: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling

item.title: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Cole1497:

technically every elder scrolls game’s land size is the same, they just scale it differently

Due to the enormity of the world, fast travel is essential. Walking to a nearby town could take up to 10 hours of real time, a far off town in another province could take several days when in Oblivion it took 10 game time hours instead of 10 real time hours. However, the size of Tamriel in Arena is more realistic.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim, give back the old rs feeling
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:3, topic:436045”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=538769.msg3942337#msg3942337 date=1331509273]
It’s awesome and does not resemble RuneScape; old or new.
[/quote]
Good thing that what you stated is a fact right? Not open to opinions whatsoever?
No but seriously, that was an unnecessary side comment there

Skyrim is pretty addicting, I love how the very large majority of the game is quests… and how there’s a near infinite amount of them.[/quote]

ye very very addicting, played hole night, had 2 hours of sleep and went to school

anyways skyrim kinda inspire me to make a kinda story line/quest server so i might go and just do it like a dragonborn on runescape killing KBD’s that attacks city’s XD

Read full topic
